alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 1:53PM CDT until May 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT FOR WEBSTER...SOUTHEASTERN DALLAS...NORTHWESTERN WRIGHT AND SOUTHWESTERN LACLEDE COUNTIES... At 150 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Niangua, or 8 miles east of Marshfield, moving east at 20 mph. A second severe thunderstorm was located over western Webster County, moving east around 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. This storm produced quarter size hail near Northview. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marshfield... Morgan... Conway... Niangua... Duncan... Phillipsburg... Twin Bridges... Elkland... Grovespring... Northview... Rader... Long Lane... Charity... Odin... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 90 and 122. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southwestern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
